009
010package imagingbook.common.histogram;
011
012/**
013 * This class represents a discrete "cumulative distribution function" 
014 * that is piecewise linear.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 *
018 */
019public class PiecewiseLinearCdf {
020        
021        private final int K;
022        private final int[] iArr;
023        private final double[] pArr;
024        
025        /**
026         * <p>
027         * Constructor, creates a {@link PiecewiseLinearCdf} from a sequence of 
028         * brightness / cumulative probability pairs.
029         * See Sec. 3.6.3 (Fig. 3.12) of [1] for additional details.
030         * Usage example:
031         * </p>
032         * <pre>
033         * int[] ik = {28, 75, 150, 210};
034         * double[] Pk = {.05, .25, .75, .95};
035         * PiecewiseLinearCdf pLCdf = new PiecewiseLinearCdf(256, ik, Pk);</pre>
036         * <p>
037         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
038         * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
039         * </p>
040         * 
041         * @param K number of brightness values (typ. 256)
042         * @param a a sequence of brightness values serving as control points
043         * @param b a sequence of cumulative probability values in [0,1], one for each control point
044         */
045        public PiecewiseLinearCdf(int K, int[] a, double[] b) {
046                this.K = K; // number of intensity values (typ. 256)
047                int N = a.length;
048                iArr = new int[N + 2];          // array of intensity values
049                pArr = new double[N + 2];       // array of cum. distribution values
050                iArr[0] = -1; 
051                pArr[0] = 0;
052                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
053                        iArr[i + 1] = a[i];
054                        pArr[i + 1] = b[i];
055                }
056                iArr[N + 1] = K - 1;
057                pArr[N + 1] = 1;
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Returns the cumulative probability for the specified intensity value.
062         * 
063         * @param i the intensity value
064         * @return the associated cumulative probability
065         */
066        public double getCdf(int i) {
067                if (i < 0)
068                        return 0;
069                else if (i >= K - 1)
070                        return 1;
071                else {
072                        int s = 0, N = iArr.length - 1;
073                        for (int j = 0; j <= N; j++) { // find s (segment index)
074                                if (iArr[j] <= i)
075                                        s = j;
076                                else
077                                        break;
078                        }
079                        return pArr[s] + (i - iArr[s])
080                                        * ((pArr[s + 1] - pArr[s]) / (iArr[s + 1] - iArr[s]));
081                }
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Returns the cumulative probabilities for the intensity values
086         * 0 to 255 as a {@code double[]}.
087         * 
088         * @return the array of cumulative probabilities
089         */
090        public double[] getCdf() {
091                double[] P = new double[256];
092                for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
093                        P[i] = this.getCdf(i);
094                }
095                return P;
096        }
097        
098        /**
099         * Returns the inverse cumulative probability function a = P<sup>-1</sup>(a), that is,
100         * the intensity value a associated with a given cum. probability P.
101         * 
102         * @param P a cumulative probability
103         * @return the associated intensity
104         */
105        public double getInverseCdf(double P) {
106                if (P < getCdf(0))
107                        return 0;
108                else if (P >= 1)
109                        return K - 1;
110                else {
111                        int r = 0, N = iArr.length - 1;
112                        for (int j = 0; j <= N; j++) { // find r (segment index)
113                                if (pArr[j] <= P)
114                                        r = j;
115                                else
116                                        break;
117                        }
118                        return iArr[r] + (P - pArr[r]) * ((iArr[r + 1] - iArr[r]) / (pArr[r + 1] - pArr[r]));
119                }
120        }
121        
122        /**
123         * Returns the probability function for this distribution
124         * as a discrete array of probabilities.
125         * 
126         * @return the probability array
127         */
128        public double[] getPdf() {      
129                double[] prob = new double[K];
130                prob[0] =  getCdf(0);
131                for (int i = 1; i < K; i++) {
132                        prob[i] =  getCdf(i) - getCdf(i-1);
133                }
134                return prob;
135        }
136        
137}
